pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people in a vehicle. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.3: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.5: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot, a palanquin, a litter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.6: One should not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.7: If a monk out of disrespect gives a teaching to someone in a vehicle who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.11: The third training rule is finished.
